sentence.text: Across the years the regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II have been increasingly implicated in the development of obesity, diabetes and its complications.

entity.text: regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: Key steps where regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II may play a pathogenic metabolic role include: (i) obesity and insulin resistance, where positive regulation of cell differentiation inhibits positive regulation of cell-matrix adhesion cell differentiation in vitro and negative regulation of cell adhesion may induce obesity and insulin resistance; (ii) elevated blood glucose levels to diabetes mellitus onset, where CCN2 may contribute to pancreatic beta cell and islet function; and (iii) in diabetes complications, such as nephropathy, retinopathy, liver disease (NAFLD/NASH), CVD and diabetes with heart failure.

entity.text: regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II
